intro: Aganisia lepida, commonly known as the slender aganisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth form with a short, upright stem and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
